CN.name: China
CN.description: Chinese mobile numbers use a standardized 11-digit format that includes carrier code and subscriber number:
rules: Next 2 digits indicate the mobile operator
Remaining 8 digits form the subscriber number

IN.name: India
IN.description: Indian mobile numbers use a standardized 10-digit format starting with specific digits and including area codes:
rules: Remaining 9 digits can be any number

US.name: United States
US.description: US phone numbers follow the North American Numbering Plan (NANP) standard format with area code and local number:
rules: Area code (3 digits) cannot start with 0 or 1
Exchange code (3 digits) followed by subscriber number (4 digits)

ID.name: Indonesia
ID.description: Indonesian mobile numbers use a 10-13 digit format starting with 8 and including provider codes:
rules: Followed by 1-2 digits for provider code

BR.name: Brazil
BR.description: Brazilian mobile numbers use a standard format with country code, area code and a 9-digit subscriber number:
rules: 4 digits followed by hyphen and 4 more digits

PK.name: Pakistan
PK.description: Pakistani mobile numbers use a standard format starting with 3 and including network codes:
rules: Followed by 2 digits for network code

NG.name: Nigeria
NG.description: Nigerian mobile numbers use a standard format including network code and subscriber number:
rules: Total length of 10 digits excluding country code

BD.name: Bangladesh
BD.description: Bangladeshi mobile numbers use a standard format starting with 1 and including operator codes:

RU.name: Russia
RU.description: Russian mobile numbers use a standard format with area code and grouped subscriber numbers:
rules: 2 digits followed by hyphen and 2 more digits

JP.name: Japan
JP.description: Japanese mobile numbers use country code +81, carrier code and 8 subscriber digits in 4-4 format:
rules: Mobile numbers start with specific carrier codes
Followed by 8 digits divided into groups of 4
